page.title: 06JANE AUSTEN'S HOUSE
page.content: Jane Austen came to Chawton in 1809.During the next few years her most famous novels were written and published. The house probably dates back to the reign of William 3rd.,originally being a posting inn and alehouse. Slight modifications and an extension have been made of the years. Today the house is a tourist attraction. Just outside the boundary wall is a speciall preserved oak tree planted in or about 1809. Every July the world-wide Jane Austen Society holds a day-long meeting in a marquee on the lawns of Chawton House.
